{"step_by_step_thinking": "Transmission of HIV from mother to child can occur during pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding. A. Oral zidovudine to mother at 3rd trimester along with oral zidovudine to infant for 6 weeks is a known method to reduce the risk of transmission. D. Stopping breastfeeding is also a method to prevent transmission as HIV can be transmitted through breast milk. C. Vaginal delivery is not a method to prevent transmission, in fact, it can increase the risk of transmission compared to a cesarean section. B. Vitamin A prophylaxis to mother is not a known method to prevent HIV transmission.", "answer_choice": "B. Vitamin A prophylaxis to mother"}
